javax.servlet.sip

Interface SipServletContext

  • All Superinterfaces:
    javax.servlet.ServletContext

    public interface SipServletContext
extends javax.servlet.ServletContext
    Defines a set of method that a SIP servlet application can use to communicate with SIP servlet container. A SIP Servlet container provides an instance of this interface as the ServletContext object to the Servlet.
    Since:
    2.0
    See Also:
    ServletContext

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface javax.servlet.ServletContext

        ORDERED_LIBS, TEMPDIR

      • addServletPOJO

        javax.servlet.ServletRegistration.Dynamic addServletPOJO(String servletName,
                                                       Object servlet)
        Registers the given servlet instance with this ServletContext under the given servletName. The registered servlet may be further configured via the returned ServletRegistration object. If this ServletContext already contains a preliminary ServletRegistration for a servlet with the given servletName, it will be completed (by assigning the name of the given servletClass to it) and returned.
        Parameters:
        servletName - the name of the servlet
        servlet - the servlet POJO instance to register
        Returns:
        a ServletRegistration object that may be used to further configure the given servlet, or null if this ServletContext already contains a complete ServletRegistration for a servlet with the given servletName or if the same servlet instance has already been registered with this or another ServletContext in the same container
        Throws:
        {@code - IllegalStateException} if this ServletContext has already been initialized

      • addServletPOJO

        javax.servlet.ServletRegistration.Dynamic addServletPOJO(String servletName,
                                                       Class<?> servletClass)
        Adds the servlet POJO with the given name and class type to this servlet context. The registered servlet may be further configured via the returned ServletRegistration object. If this ServletContext already contains a preliminary ServletRegistration for a servlet with the given servletName, it will be completed (by assigning the name of the given servletClass to it) and returned. This method introspects the given class for the annotations except SipServlet In addition, this method supports resource injection if the given clazz represents a Managed Bean. See the SIP servlet specification for the dependency injection requirements.
        Parameters:
        servletName - the name of the servlet POJO.
        servletClass - the class object from which the servlet will be instantiated.
        Returns:
        a ServletRegistration object that may be used to further configure the registered servlet, or null if this ServletContext already contains a complete ServletRegistration for the given servletName
        Throws:
        {@code - IllegalStateException} if this ServletContext has already been initialized

      • createServletPOJO

        <T> T createServletPOJO(Class<T> clazz)
                    throws javax.servlet.ServletException
        Instantiates the given Servlet POJO class. The returned Servlet instance may be further customized before it is registered with this ServletContext via a call to addServletPOJO(String,Object). The given Servlet POJO class must define a zero argument constructor, which is used to instantiate it. This method introspects the given clazz for the annotations except SipServlet In addition, this method supports resource injection if the given clazz represents a Managed Bean. See the SIP servlet specification for the dependency injection requirements.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the Servlet POJO class to instantiate
        Returns:
        the new Servlet POJO instance
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException - if the given clazz fails to be instantiated

      • getSipApplicationConfiguration

        SipApplicationConfiguration getSipApplicationConfiguration()
        Returns the SipApplicationConfiguration object that represents the application configuration. It may be used by the application to further configure the application.
        Returns:
        SipApplicationConfiguration instance.
        See Also:
        SipApplicationConfiguration

      • getFlow

        Flow getFlow(String flowToken)
        Returns the flow represented by the flow token. SIP servlets use this method to retrieve the Flow object from the container.
        Returns:
        Flow represented by the flow token. Null, if there is no usable flow represented by the flow token exist.
        Since:
        2.0
        See Also:
        Flow

      • assignWebSocketSipIdentity

        void assignWebSocketSipIdentity(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest httpRequest,
                              String sipIdentity)
        Once a user is authenticated, assign a SIP identity for that HttpServletRequest. If a websocket connection is established for this user within the same authentication context, then the SIP messages sent on that websocket connection will be authenticated using the specified SIP identity.
        Parameters:
        httpRequest - Authenticated HttpServletRequest object.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if the HttpServletRequest is not authenticated.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the sipIdentity is null.
        Since:
        2.0

      • getSipWebSocketContext

        SipWebSocketContext getSipWebSocketContext(String flowToken)
        Retrieve the SipWebSocketContext that the flow token represents.
        Parameters:
        flowToken - A string representing the Flow of the SIP WebSocket Connection.
        Returns:
        SipWebSocketContext if the flowToken represents a SIP over WebSocket Connection. Null, otherwise.
